title: (no subject)
body:
The pilot light on the heater won’t work, the ducks are out of the coop, 



The horizon is ledgered with birches and each morning I have



Nightmares about a particular copse



Last week Wesley went to in-patient and Jolie got a job pulling up lobsters



This morning, the propane man was quite breath-heavy 



And went from his knees to floating up into the vent, the main heat, 



Where he fixed it by curling up in there, like a rat.



I have walked for days through the wintered woods



Found many species of no particular relation to me, 



Mammalian jaws lapping up me as if I were part of their geologic



Tradition of dying out



(Which I am)



A walk in the frozen woods that may not build



in the same way sediment does



It’s not so much that nothing means anything



But that the meaning phases in and out



The signs outside RiteAid might as well dictate the universe, 



The more people buy, the same amount of space there is to exist



I watch Jeopardy reruns, the operative brains, and take note of where it all goes



The more people know, the same distance they are from their mortality



Hailing from Sonora, where a summer memory rests, a cool wind blows across the kitchen, Unfurling curtains of sand



Showering a sky the color and shape of the ceiling



And blocking the television screen



Just kidding I don’t have a television



The room is cold and my batteries are low



Said the Mars rover, who died more sentient and less alone than some of us will



Such an openness in oxygenated space, foil to the carbon mouth-breathing of the working sad 



Just trying to be alone with hints of other voices, of silks blossoming into new robes



For the not showered



Their everyday more a muscle 



Than its qualifier
